tasks.title: Set up database schema for users and tasks
tasks.description: Design and implement the core database tables to store user accounts and task data. This foundation enables all other features by providing persistent data storage with proper relationships between users and their tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Users need secure data storage to maintain their tasks across sessions
acceptanceCriteria: Users table stores email, password hash, and timestamps
Tasks table stores title, description, due_date, priority, status, category_id, user_id
Categories table stores name and user_id
Foreign key relationships are properly established
Database indexes are created for performance
edgeCasesToHandle: Ensure data integrity with proper constraints

tasks.title: Build user registration and login API endpoints
tasks.description: Create secure authentication endpoints that handle user registration, login, and password validation. This enables users to create accounts and access their personal task data securely.
tasks.featureContext: Users need secure access to their personal task data
acceptanceCriteria: POST /register creates new user with email validation
POST /login authenticates user and returns session token
Passwords are properly hashed before storage
Invalid credentials return appropriate error messages
Email uniqueness is enforced

tasks.title: Create user registration and login forms
tasks.description: Build responsive web forms for user registration and login with proper validation and error handling. These forms provide the user interface for account creation and access, connecting to the authentication API.
tasks.featureContext: Users need an intuitive way to create accounts and sign in
acceptanceCriteria: Registration form collects email and password with confirmation
Login form has email and password fields
Client-side validation shows immediate feedback
Forms display server error messages clearly
Responsive design works on mobile and desktop

tasks.title: Implement session management and authentication middleware
tasks.description: Create middleware that manages user sessions and protects authenticated routes throughout the application. This ensures users stay logged in across page refreshes and prevents unauthorized access to task data.
tasks.featureContext: Users need persistent login sessions and secure access control
acceptanceCriteria: Middleware validates session tokens on protected routes
Sessions expire after appropriate timeout period
Invalid sessions redirect to login page
User context is available throughout the application
Logout functionality clears session properly
edgeCasesToHandle: Expired session tokens during active use

tasks.title: Build main application layout and navigation
tasks.description: Create the primary application shell with navigation, header, and main content areas. This layout provides the foundation for all task management features and ensures consistent user experience across the application.
tasks.featureContext: Users need a clean, organized interface to access task management features
acceptanceCriteria: Header displays user email and logout button
Navigation provides access to main task views
Main content area adapts to different screen sizes
Loading states are handled gracefully
Consistent styling throughout the application
edgeCasesToHandle: Very long user email addresses in header

tasks.title: Create task data model and API structure
tasks.description: Define the task data structure and create API endpoints for basic CRUD operations on tasks. This establishes the foundation for all task management features and ensures consistent data handling throughout the application.
tasks.featureContext: All task features depend on a solid data foundation and API structure
riskFlags: API design decisions affecting future features
acceptanceCriteria: GET /tasks returns user's tasks with proper filtering
POST /tasks creates new task with validation
PUT /tasks/:id updates existing task
DELETE /tasks/:id removes task
All endpoints require authentication and return appropriate errors
edgeCasesToHandle: Deleting tasks belonging to other users

tasks.title: Build task creation form and functionality
tasks.description: Create an intuitive form that allows users to add new tasks with title, description, due date, and priority. This core feature enables users to capture their to-do items quickly and efficiently with all essential information.
tasks.featureContext: Users need a fast, easy way to capture new tasks as they arise
acceptanceCriteria: Form has fields for title, description, due date, and priority
Title field is required and validated
Due date uses calendar picker interface
Priority dropdown shows High, Medium, Low options
Form submission creates task and updates task list immediately
edgeCasesToHandle: Very long task titles or descriptions

tasks.title: Build main task list display component
tasks.description: Create the primary interface for viewing all user tasks with proper formatting, sorting, and visual hierarchy. This central component gives users an overview of all their tasks and serves as the hub for task management activities.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to see all their tasks in an organized, scannable format
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks display in clean, scannable list format
Each task shows title, due date, priority, and status
List updates immediately when tasks are added or modified
Empty state shows helpful message for new users
List performs well with 100+ tasks
edgeCasesToHandle: Tasks without due dates or priorities

tasks.title: Implement task editing and deletion functionality
tasks.description: Add the ability to modify existing tasks and delete unwanted ones through intuitive UI controls. This completes the basic CRUD operations and gives users full control over their task data with proper confirmation flows.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to update task details and remove completed or cancelled tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Edit button opens task in editable form with current values
Delete button shows confirmation dialog before removing task
Edit form saves changes and updates list immediately
Cancel functionality discards unsaved changes
Optimistic updates provide immediate feedback
edgeCasesToHandle: Editing task that was deleted by another session

tasks.title: Create task completion toggle functionality
tasks.description: Implement the ability to mark tasks as complete or incomplete with immediate visual feedback and status updates. This satisfying interaction is core to the task management experience and provides users with a sense of progress.
tasks.featureContext: Users need the satisfying experience of marking tasks complete
acceptanceCriteria: Checkbox or button toggles task completion status
Completed tasks show visual distinction (strikethrough, dimmed)
Status changes save immediately to database
Completion timestamp is recorded
Toggle works consistently across all task views
edgeCasesToHandle: Status changes while task is being edited

tasks.title: Implement visual indicators for task status
tasks.description: Create clear visual distinctions between completed and incomplete tasks using styling, icons, and layout changes. This visual feedback helps users quickly identify task states and provides satisfaction when completing items.
tasks.featureContext: Users need immediate visual feedback about task completion status
acceptanceCriteria: Completed tasks show strikethrough text and dimmed appearance
Incomplete tasks have clear, readable styling
Checkmarks or icons indicate completion status
Visual changes are accessible to colorblind users
Status indicators work across different screen sizes
edgeCasesToHandle: Tasks with very long titles and status indicators
Color accessibility for various visual impairments

tasks.title: Add completion timestamp tracking and display
tasks.description: Store and display when tasks were completed to provide users with progress insights and a sense of accomplishment. This feature adds valuable context about productivity patterns and task completion history.
tasks.featureContext: Users benefit from seeing when they completed tasks for progress tracking
acceptanceCriteria: Completion timestamp is stored when task is marked complete
Timestamp is cleared when task is marked incomplete
Completed tasks show 'Completed on [date]' in readable format
Timestamps are displayed in user's local timezone
Historical completion data is preserved
edgeCasesToHandle: Tasks completed and uncompleted multiple times
Tasks completed before timestamp feature was added

tasks.title: Implement priority level assignment and indicators
tasks.description: Add the ability to set High, Medium, or Low priority levels for tasks with clear visual indicators like colors or icons. This helps users identify their most important work and make better decisions about task ordering.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to identify and focus on their most important tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Priority dropdown shows High, Medium, Low options
High priority tasks display with red color/icon
Medium priority tasks display with yellow color/icon
Low priority tasks display with green color/icon
Priority changes save immediately and update visual indicators
edgeCasesToHandle: Priority indicators on different screen sizes

tasks.title: Create priority-based task sorting and filtering
tasks.description: Allow users to sort their task list by priority level and filter to show only high-priority items. This functionality helps users focus on what matters most and reduces cognitive load when reviewing their task list.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to quickly access their most important tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Sort dropdown includes 'Priority' option
Priority sort shows High, then Medium, then Low tasks
Filter options include 'High Priority Only'
Sort preferences persist during session
Sorting works with other filters and search
edgeCasesToHandle: Mixed priority and date sorting preferences

tasks.title: Design prominent display for high-priority tasks
tasks.description: Create visual emphasis for high-priority tasks to ensure they stand out in the task list and capture user attention. This might include special positioning, styling, or dedicated sections to highlight urgent work.
tasks.featureContext: High-priority tasks must be immediately visible to guide user focus
acceptanceCriteria: High-priority tasks appear at top of list regardless of other sorting
High-priority tasks have bold styling or background highlight
Visual emphasis doesn't overwhelm other task information
Design works well with completed task styling
Responsive design maintains priority visibility on mobile
edgeCasesToHandle: Many high-priority tasks creating visual overload
Priority emphasis with very long task titles

tasks.title: Build due date calendar picker and validation
tasks.description: Implement a user-friendly date picker interface for setting task due dates with proper validation to prevent past dates or invalid selections. This component enables effective deadline management for time-sensitive tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Users need an intuitive way to set and manage task deadlines
acceptanceCriteria: Calendar picker opens when due date field is clicked
Selected date populates the form field correctly
Past dates show warning but don't prevent selection
Date format displays consistently (e.g., MM/DD/YYYY)
Picker works on both desktop and mobile devices
edgeCasesToHandle: Date picker on small mobile screens

tasks.title: Create overdue and upcoming deadline indicators
tasks.description: Implement visual alerts for overdue tasks and approaching deadlines to help users manage time-sensitive work effectively. These indicators should be prominent enough to capture attention without overwhelming the interface.
tasks.featureContext: Users need clear warnings about missed and approaching deadlines
acceptanceCriteria: Overdue tasks display with red background or border
Tasks due today show orange warning indicator
Tasks due within 3 days show yellow upcoming indicator
Due date calculations account for user timezone
Indicators update automatically at midnight
edgeCasesToHandle: Tasks due at specific times vs. end of day
Timezone changes affecting due date calculations
Date calculations around daylight saving changes

tasks.title: Implement due date sorting and filtering options
tasks.description: Add sorting by due date (earliest first) and filtering options to show only overdue tasks or tasks due within specific timeframes. This helps users focus on time-sensitive work and manage deadlines effectively.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to quickly access tasks by deadline urgency
acceptanceCriteria: Sort by due date shows earliest dates first
Tasks without due dates appear after dated tasks
Filter options include 'Overdue', 'Due Today', 'Due This Week'
Date sorting works with other sort criteria
Filters can be combined with search and priority filters
edgeCasesToHandle: Tasks with no due date in date-sorted list

tasks.title: Build task category creation and management
tasks.description: Create the interface and logic for users to create custom categories or lists to organize their tasks by project, context, or personal system. This organizational feature helps users group related tasks and reduce mental load.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to group related tasks for better organization
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create new categories with custom names
Category list shows in sidebar or dropdown menu
Default 'Uncategorized' category exists for new tasks
Users can edit category names and delete empty categories
Category creation validates name uniqueness and length
edgeCasesToHandle: Maximum number of categories per user

tasks.title: Implement task assignment to categories
tasks.description: Add the ability to assign tasks to categories during creation and editing, with easy category switching through dropdown selection. This completes the organizational system and allows users to group tasks meaningfully.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to assign tasks to their organizational system
acceptanceCriteria: Task creation form includes category dropdown
Task edit form allows category changes
Category dropdown shows user's custom categories
Tasks display their assigned category in list view
Bulk category assignment for multiple selected tasks
edgeCasesToHandle: Tasks created before category system existed

tasks.title: Create category filtering and organization views
tasks.description: Build filtering options to show tasks from specific categories and create organized views where users can see tasks grouped by category. This makes the organizational system useful for daily task management workflows.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to view and work within their organizational system
acceptanceCriteria: Filter dropdown includes all user categories
Selecting category shows only tasks in that category
Category view shows collapsible sections for each category
Task counts display next to category names
Empty categories show helpful empty state message
edgeCasesToHandle: Very large categories with many tasks
Category names that are very long

tasks.title: Add password reset and basic account settings
tasks.description: Implement password reset functionality and basic account management features to complete the user authentication system. This provides users with essential account security and management capabilities.
tasks.featureContext: Users need secure way to recover access and manage their accounts
acceptanceCriteria: Forgot password link sends reset email to user
Reset link expires after reasonable time period
Password reset form validates new password strength
Account settings page allows password changes
Email address changes require verification
edgeCasesToHandle: Password reset for non-existent email addresses

cycles.description: Core setup, authentication, and basic task structure

cycles.name: Core Task Management
cycles.description: Essential task operations and status tracking

cycles.name: Priority and Organization
cycles.description: Task prioritization, due dates, and categorization

cycles.name: Polish and Enhancement
cycles.description: UI improvements, validation, and user experience enhancements
